abstract: In an unusual type of bond deal that might have had even Freud pondering its morbid implications, companies like the American International Group, Bank of America and GE Capital issue discounted bonds to buyers who have teamed up with someone who is about to die, The Wall Street Journal reports.

lead_paragraph: In an unusual type of bond deal that might have had even Freud pondering its morbid implications, companies like the American International Group, Bank of America and GE Capital issue discounted bonds to buyers who have teamed up with someone who is about to die, The Wall Street Journal reports.
